clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of 60-days Saccharomyces Boulardii and Superoxide Dismutase Supplementation in Obese Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of 60-days Saccharomyces Boulardii and Superoxide Dismutase Supplementation on Body Composition, Hunger Sensation, Pro/Antioxidant Ratio, Inflammation and Hormonal Lipo-metabolic Biomarkers in Obese Adults: a Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Azienda di Servizi alla Persona di Pavia

clinical_study.source: Azienda di Servizi alla Persona di Pavia

brief_summary.textblock: In animals it has been demonstrated that Saccharomyces boulardii decrease low-grade inflammation and fat mass; also Superoxide Dismutase (SOD) decrease low-grade inflammation. Therefore, the aim of this double-blind, placebo-controlled clinical trial was to assess the effect of a 60-days S. boulardii and SOD supplementation on circulating markers of inflammation, body composition, hunger sensation, pro/antioxidant ratio, hormonal, lipid profile, glucose, insulin and HOMA-IR, in obese adults (BMI 30-35 kg/m2).

primary_outcome.measure: Change on concentration of biochemical parameters for hunger sensation and hormonal status
primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline biochemical parameters for hunger sensation and hormonal status at 8 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Change on concentration of biochemical parameters for hunger sensation and hormonal status
primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline biochemical parameters for hunger sensation and hormonal status at 8 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Change on concentration of biochemical parameters for hunger sensation and hormonal status
primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline biochemical parameters for hunger sensation and hormonal status at 8 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Change on concentration of biochemical parameters for glico-metabolic status
primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline biochemical parameters for glico-metabolic status at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Total cholesterol (mg/dL), Low Density Lipoprotein cholesterol (mg/dL), HDL cholesterol (mg/dL), Triglycerides (mg/dL), Apolipoprotein A (mg/dL), Apolipoprotein B (mg/dL), Glycemia (mg/dL), Uric acid (mg/dL)

primary_outcome.measure: Change on concentration of biochemical parameters for glico-metabolic status
primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline biochemical parameters for glico-metabolic status at 8 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Change on concentration of biochemical parameters for glico-metabolic status
primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline biochemical parameters for glico-metabolic status at 8 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Change on concentration of biochemical parameters for glico-metabolic status
primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline biochemical parameters for glico-metabolic status at 8 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Change on state of hunger, fullness, desire to eat, satiety and prospective food consumption
primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline state of hunger, fullness, desire to eat, satiety and prospective food consumption at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Eating motivation Visual Analogue Scale (pt): a scale from 0 to 10 points. The scale of hunger (question: "how hungry are you?") ranged from the answer "not at all" to "as hungry as I have ever felt"; the scale of fullness (question: "how full are you?") ranged from the answer "not at all" to "as full as I ever felt"; the scale of satiety (question: "how satiated are you?") ranged from "not at all" to "extremely"; the scale of desire (question: "how strong is your desire to eat?") ranged from "very weak" to "very strong"; the scale of prospective consumption (question: "how much do you think you could (or would want to) eat right now) ranged from "nothing at all" to "a very large amount"

secondary_outcome.measure: Change on concentration of biochemical parameters for nutritional status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline biochemical parameters for nutritional status at 8 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change on concentration of biochemical parameters for hormonal status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline biochemical parameters for hormonal status at 8 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change on concentration of biochemical parameters for inflammation and cardiovascular risk
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline biochemical parameters for inflammation and cardiovascular risk at 8 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change on concentration of biochemical parameters for inflammation and cardiovascular risk
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline biochemical parameters for inflammation and cardiovascular risk at 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor Necrosis Factor-α (pg/mL), Inter Leukin-1β (pg/mL), Inter Leukin-6 (pg/mL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change on concentration of biochemical parameters for inflammation and cardiovascular risk
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline biochemical parameters for inflammation and cardiovascular risk at 8 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change on concentration of biochemical parameters for safety
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline biochemical parameters for safety at 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Aspartate amino transferase (U/L), Alanine amino transferase (U/L), Gamma Glutamyl Transferase (U/L)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change on concentration of biochemical parameters for safety
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline biochemical parameters for safety at 8 weeks

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline anthropometric measures at 8 weeks

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline anthropometric measures at 8 weeks

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline anthropometric measures at 8 weeks

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline body composition at 8 weeks

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline body composition at 8 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change on rate of body composition
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline body composition at 8 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change on status of mood assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline mood assessment at 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Beck questionnaire (pt). The questionnaire is divided into 21 items which have a score from 0 to 3. A total score > 17 indicates borderline depression; > 21 moderate depression; > 31 severe depression; > 40 extreme depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change on status of assessment of food preferences
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline assessment of food preferences at 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Food Frequency Questionnaire (pt). Participants must indicate the consumption of 18 common food items, choosing one between "yes" or "no, never". Participants were also asked to estimate their usual rate of consumption, choosing from seven categories of frequency, ranging from ''never'' or ''less than once a week'' to ''seven times per week". The only exception was constituted by the item "coffee consumption", which is reported as "cups/day".

arm_group.description: A complex of 250 mg of Saccharomyces boulardii and 500 IU SOD to be assumed twice/day for 8 weeks at mealtimes
A placebo consisting of capsules containing the same excipients except the active compounds, and the same coating

intervention.description: A complex of 250 mg of Saccharomyces boulardii and 500 IU SOD to be assumed twice/day for 8 weeks at mealtimes
A placebo consisting of capsules containing the same excipients except the active compounds, and the same coating

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- I class of obesity (BMI: 30-35 Kg/m2)
Exclusion Criteria:
- evidence of heart, kidney or liver disease
- diagnosis of major depressive disorder
- current medications for weight loss, for control of cholesterol and triglycerides
- anti-inflammatory treatments
- pregrancy of lactation
- type 1 diabetes mellitus, intestinal inflammatory bowel disease, celiac disease, chronic pancreatitis
- probiotic/prebiotic treatment in the last 4 weeks
- antibiotic use within the last 3 months

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Azienda di Servizi alla Persona di Pavia
